remarks: A sum over a pair is the sum of the elements.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 12-Dec-2016.)
statement:
sumpr.1 $e |- ( k = A -> C = D ) $.
sumpr.2 $e |- ( k = B -> C = E ) $.
sumpr.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( D e. CC /\ E e. CC ) ) $.
sumpr.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( A e. V /\ B e. W ) ) $.
sumpr.5 $e |- ( ph -> A =/= B ) $.
sumpr $p |- ( ph -> sum_ k e. { A , B } C = ( D + E ) ) $.
$d A k $.
$d B k $.
$d D k $.
$d E k $.
$d V k $.
$d W k $.
$d k ph $.
